channel.title: Converting batch to .sh!
channel.description:
[code] @echo off
:main title Server cls set java="%jpath%\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp . server goto main [/code]
Can someone help me transfer this to a .sh file
i got lost at the !bin/bash crap lol
Yea i already have that converter table thing and im confused!

item.title: Converting batch to .sh!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“pwnm30rdi3, post:5, topic:178191”]Nail, i already have that table… Also how would i run this? What would i type?

Is there another way i can loop the server without the .sh?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 03, 2008, 06:13:37 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=239166.msg2030228#msg2030228 date=1202053441]

#!/bin/sh clear #Should really add this to /home/urname/.bashrc export PATH=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun:$PATH java -Xmx1024m -classpath . server sleep
Not so sure if that’s correct, as I typed it off my head…
[/quote]
Then why the fuck did you not say?
You want it too loop back if the script completes?

that wont loop…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Converting batch to .sh!
item.dc:creator: @pwnm30rdi3 pwnm30rdi3
item.description:
@pwnm30rdi3 wrote:

@echo off

:main
  title Server
  cls
  set java="%jpath%\bin\java.exe"
  java -Xmx1024m -cp . server
  goto main

Can someone help me transfer this to a .sh file

i got lost at the !bin/bash crap lol

Yea i already have that converter table thing and im confused!

Read full topic
